name: Titanium.UI.CoverFlowView
summary: The cover flow view is a container showing animated three-dimensional images in a style consistent with the cover flow presentation used for iPod, iTunes, and file browsing.

events.name: click
events.summary: Fired when the user clicks on the view.
events.description:
There is a subtle difference between singletap and click events.

A singletap event is generated when the user taps the screen briefly without moving their finger. This gesture will also generate a click event.

However, a click event can also be generated when the user touches, moves their finger, and then removes it from the screen.

On Android, a click event can also be generated by a trackball click.

properties.name: index
properties.summary: Index of the image that is now visible.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

events.name: change
events.summary: Fired when the user changes the image using a gesture.

properties.name: index

methods.name: setImage
methods.summary: Changes the image for a specified index.
methods.description:
To specify a size for the image, you may pass the image as a simple dictionary, as defined in CoverFlowImageType. If you specify a size, the size must be exact, not a percentage size.

If the image is passed as a File object or file path, the filename is checked. filename includes the '@2x' or '@3x' string used to identify high-resolution images for the Retina (HD) display, the image is treated accordingly.

properties.name: images
properties.summary: Array of images to display in the view.
